snippet: The study will follow 4,000 children to see if curriculum can create lasting improvement in students’ skills and a likelihood to persevere academically.
abstract: Six-year study involving 4,000 children of different racial and economic backgrounds in Brooklyn, financed by the Robin Hood Foundation, is expected to answer fundamental question of whether preschool actually creates lasting improvement in students' math and language skills; study, coming as New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio prepares to greatly expand city's preschool offerings, will follow children attending Public School 221 in Crown Heights.
lead_paragraph: The study will follow 4,000 children to see if curriculum can create lasting improvement in students’ skills and a likelihood to persevere academically.

headline.main: A Study Seeks to Determine What Makes Prekindergarten Successful
headline.print_headline: Going Beyond Funding Debate, a Study Explores What Makes Pre-K Work
